reviews.review: este juego es una joya su modo online y su historia es muy buena

#RememberFreeman 
Game is so legendary why wouldn't you play it

#RememberFreeman

here are some of my favorite quotes in this game
"FOR GOD'S SAKE MAN, OPEN THE SILO DOOR!"

"why do we all have to wear these ridiculous ties"

"Gordon! Get away from the beams!"

"Shutting down. Attempting shut down. It's not...it's-it's not...it's not shutting down...it's not... AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH"

Un clásico del gaming. Probablemente ya lo conozcas, pero si no lo conoces, la historia es atrapante, los desafíos son exactos, y la acción justa lo vuelven muy disfrutable. Sigue los inicios de la historia de Gordon Freeman, un científico que se ve envuelto en una serie de consecuencias imprevistas. Recomiendo esta versión por sobre la versión "Half Life Source". Si te gustó la historia y te gustaría jugarlo con gráficos más actualizados, prueba "Black Mesa", un remake hecho por una comunidad de fans. 
Esta versión de half life no requiere muchos recursos, puedes jugarlo en casi cualquier pc. Aprovecha cuando está de oferta el Valve Complete Pack y llevate esta joya y muchas más a un precio imbatible

Great game with great gameplay, sounds, music, story, ambince and even tons of mods made by commuity.

#RememberFreeman

Also, game is still a classic. XD

I had high expectations of this legendary game. I thought I would enjoy it based on the charm of it being such an old game which is nostalgic for many people. What I didn't expect is that it would hold up so well and force me to sink hours into it each day until I finished.

I hated those fucking fish monsters. I, for a lack of better words, literally pissed myself every time i had to go into the water to fight one.
I will never forget the first time. The cage hanging above the water, the scientist warning me about it, the crossbow in said cage. Walking towards it and grabbing it only for the cage to break and drop me into the water. Watching it swim towards me as I equipped one of my guns. Trying to fire at it only for nothing to happen. Cycling through all of my guns to try and somehow kill it and save me from the hell known as 'the underwater level' but nothing worked. Watching as it shredded me as I stood there, unable to do anything but watch.
Every time I saw one after that I felt a sense of pure dread despite now knowing how to kill it.
9/10
It started it all for me. Theres nothing like it. 10/10.

#RememberFreeman

This review serves as a mark of my participation in this event. ♥ ♥ ♥
Playing half-life 1 is basically a requirement. It's a piece of gaming history and oodles of fun and it's almost always on sale. You won't regret this buy.
12K players on this game. I recommend it.

Glad to be participated on the fourteenth of August 2022 to break the record.
#RememberFreeman 12K Players.

Пишу этот отзыв чтобы выразить свою радость - сегодня, 14.08.22, участвовал в постановке рекорда по онлайну, и мы сделали это ребята!
12 280 человек зашли одновременно в первую халву, чтобы снова почувствовать этот кайф и ностальгию, треш и угар, веселье и задор, которые творятся в мультиплеере, особенно на карте crossfire.
Давно я так не хохотал в играх :)

Fun, but hard. Though it starts somewhat easy, around later chapters it starts to get a lot harder. I got stuck in countless death loops, and even had to search up some tutorials online. (didn't want to search to much, as to not ruin the experience). Overall, very fun game, pretty good graphics for when it came out (1998 i think), and posed a challenge, as it wasn't clear on where you needed to go sometimes. I give it a 10/10!

One thing I don't know why
It doesn't even matter how hard you try
Keep that in mind, I designed this rhyme
To explain in due time
All I know
Time is a valuable thing
Watch it fly by as the pendulum swings
Watch it count down to the end of the day
The clock ticks life away
It's so unreal
Didn't look out below
Watch the time go right out the window
Tryin' to hold on, did-didn't even know
I wasted it all just to watch you go
I kept everything inside and even though I tried
It all fell apart
What it meant to me will eventually
Be a memory of a time when I tried so hard
I tried so hard and got so far
But in the end it doesn't even matter
I had to fall to lose it all
But in the end it doesn't even matter
